definition: ability to make one's own decisions
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Women have gained the right of self-determination in marriage.
sentences.chinese: 中国妇女获得了婚姻自主权。

sentences.english: The latter was given an autonomy and even a pre-eminence as a philosophical issue.
sentences.chinese: 后者被给予自主权，甚至优先作为哲学的议题。

sentences.english: If we decentralize, the provinces will have more autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们将权力下放，各省就有更多的自主权。

sentences.english: Maybe, she suggested, we don't own ourselves after all.
sentences.chinese: 她提出，也许我们终究并不拥有自主权。

sentences.english: Will it further decentralize decision-making for artists?
sentences.chinese: 它会不会进一步削弱艺术家的自主权？

sentences.english: We will further simplify examination and approval procedures, and give enterprises decision-making power over their overseas investments.
sentences.chinese: 进一步简化各类审批手续，落实企业境外投资自主权。

sentences.english: In no case is a subject an autonomous entity.
sentences.chinese: 生命主体决非是一个具有自主权的主体。

sentences.english: I'm not doing that anymore. You are taking ownership.
sentences.chinese: 我不会再那样做，你们掌握自主权。

sentences.english: 'Well, we all want to do that, 'replied Colonel Fitzwilliam.
sentences.chinese: “哎，我们都想有自主权，”费茨威廉上校回答说。

sentences.english: Where is the Sabah and Sarawak autonomy?
sentences.chinese: 沙巴和沙捞越的自主权在哪里？

sentences.english: The fundamental source of Moro 's frustrations is their inability to hold on cultural heritage with themselves.
sentences.chinese: 文化自主权的丧失才是摩洛人困境的根本缘由。

sentences.english: But just how much autonomy Mr Gao has is uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 但是，高具有多大的自主权仍然不得而知。

sentences.english: To some degree, the schools have the some rights of self decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 学校在课程上有了部分的决策自主权。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
ability to have one's say and be listened to/influence/clout
property ownership or right/financial power/financial control
responsible for its profit and losses (of organization)/financially autonomous/personal financial responsibility
